snippet: In a change from previous debates, the candidates dove into the gritty details of economic plans and entitlement programs, but exchanges grew contentious and political friendships were strained.

byline.contributor: Patrick Healy reported from New York, and Jonathan Martin from Boulder, Colo.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Republican candidates trade barbed attacks in third presidential debate that reflects changing dynamics and jostling for position among contenders; Jeb Bush and Donald J Trump, once dominant in race, fade into background as Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz are bolstered by strong performances.
lead_paragraph: In a change from previous debates, the candidates dove into the gritty details of economic plans and entitlement programs, but exchanges grew contentious and political friendships were strained.

headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Candidates Take Sharp Tone in Third Debate
headline.main: Republican Candidates Take Sharp Tone in Third Debate
